div.p: Alerts are created through the makealerts custom command.
Assuming you have a search that output a list of events with _time, type, entity and other fields, you can pipe those to makealerts to create alerts:
This will insert alerts as records in the alerts kv store. All non-internal fields are saved. If an alert with the same field values already exists, then it will not be inserted.
The time, type and entity field names can be specified as arguments. The kv store internal key can also be attached to the event:
div.pre: | savedsearch mysearch | makealerts time=event_time entity=clientip type=alert_name idfield=kv_key
div.p: You can then check alerts on the Alerts panel and get reporting metrics on the Reports panel

div.pre: | listalerts | search NOT type="realtime test" | table kv_key | updatealerts key=kv_key action=close status=closed notes="batch close"
div.p: Batch replace of alert content to change the type from ioc to ioc1:
div.pre: | listalerts json=json | search type=ioc | jsontofields json=json prefix=data_ typeprefix=t | eval s_data_type="ioc1" | fieldstojson json=jsonnew prefix=data_ | updatealerts json=jsonnew notes="updated manually"
div.p: How long it takes to close an alert:
div.pre: | listalerts status="closed" json=json | jsontofields json=json work_log | mvexpand work_log | jsontofields json=work_log prefix=wl_ time, action | search wl_action=close OR wl_action=create | stats first(wl_time) as closetime, last(wl_time) as createtime by kv_key | eval hours=(closetime - createtime)/3600 | convert ctime(closetime) | convert ctime(createtime) | table kv_key, closetime, createtime, hours
